ApiVersion.description:
- since API version formats range from 
Azure ARM API date style (2018-01-01) to semver (1.2.3) 
and virtually any other text, this value tends to be an 
opaque string with the possibility of a modifier to indicate
that it is a range.

options: 
- prepend a dash or append a plus to indicate a range 
(ie, '2018-01-01+' or '-2019-01-01', or '1.0+' )

- semver-range style (ie, '^1.0.0' or '~1.0.0' )

version.description: the actual api version string used in the API

Deprecation.description: represents  deprecation information for a given aspect

apiVersions.description: the api versions that this deprecation is applicable to.

Extensions.description: A dictionary of open-ended 'x-*' extensions propogated from the original source document.

defaultValue.description: If the value isn't sent on the wire, the service will assume this

$key.description: common name of the aspect -- in OAI3 this was typically the key in the parent dictionary

apiVersions.description: API versions that this applies to. Undefined means all versions

deprecated.description: deprecation information -- ie, when this aspect doesn't apply and why

Languages.description: custom extensible metadata for individual language generators

Protocols.description: custom extensible metadata for individual protocols (ie, HTTP, etc)

Metadata.description: common pattern for Metadata on aspects

Language.description: the bare-minimum fields for per-language metadata on a given aspect

Protocol.description: the bare-minimum fields for per-protocol metadata on a given aspect

SerializationFormats.description: custom extensible metadata for individual serialization formats

SchemaType.description: possible schema types that indicate the type of schema.

Value.description: common base interface for properties, parameters and the like.

nullable.description: can null be passed in instead

apiVersions.description: API versions that this applies to. Undefined means all versions

deprecated.description: deprecation information -- ie, when this aspect doesn't apply and why

Property.description: a property is a child value in an object

readOnly.description: if the property is marked read-only (ie, not intended to be sent to the service)

serializedName.description: the wire name of this property

isDiscriminator.description: if this property is used as a discriminator for a polymorphic type

Parameter.description: a definition of an discrete input for an operation

implementation.description: suggested implementation location for this parameter

ValueSchema.description: schema types that are non-object or complex types

PrimitiveSchema.description: Schema types that are primitive language values

ComplexSchema.description: schema types that can be objects

NumberSchema.description: a Schema that represents a Number value

precision.description: precision (# of bits?) of the number

multipleOf.description: if present, the number must be an exact multiple of this value

maximum.description: if present, the value must be lower than or equal to this (unless exclusiveMaximum is true)

exclusiveMaximum.description: if present, the value must be lower than maximum

minimum.description: if present, the value must be highter than or equal to this (unless exclusiveMinimum is true)

exclusiveMinimum.description: if present, the value must be higher than minimum

StringSchema.description: a Schema that represents a string value

maxLength.description: the maximum length of the string

minLength.description: the minimum length of the string

pattern.description: a regular expression that the string must be validated against

ArraySchema.description: a Schema that represents and array of values

maxItems.description: maximum number of elements in the array

minItems.description: minimum number of elements in the array

uniqueItems.description: if the elements in the array should be unique

ParameterGroupSchema.description: a schema that represents a set of parameters.

parameters.description: the collection of properties that are in this object

ObjectSchema.description: a schema that represents a type with child properties.

discriminator.description: the property of the polymorphic descriminator for this type, if there is one

properties.description: the collection of properties that are in this object

ChoiceValue.description: an individual choice in a ChoiceSchema

ChoiceSchema.description: a schema that represents a choice of several values (ie, an 'enum')

choiceType.description: the primitive type for the choices

choices.description: the possible choices for in the set

SealedChoiceSchema.description: a schema that represents a choice of several values (ie, an 'enum')

choiceType.description: the primitive type for the choices

choices.description: the possible choices for in the set
the possible choices for in the set

ConstantValue.description: a container for the actual constant value

value.description: the actual constant value to use

ConstantSchema.description: a schema that represents a constant value

constantSchema.description: the schema type of the constant value (ie, StringSchema, NumberSchema, etc)

BooleanSchema.description: a schema that represents a boolean value

ODataQuerySchema.description: a schema that represents a ODataQuery value

CredentialSchema.description: a schema that represents a Credential value

maxLength.description: the maximum length of the string

minLength.description: the minimum length of the string

pattern.description: a regular expression that the string must be validated against

UriSchema.description: a schema that represents a Uri value

maxLength.description: the maximum length of the string

minLength.description: the minimum length of the string

pattern.description: a regular expression that the string must be validated against

UuidSchema.description: a schema that represents a Uuid value

DurationSchema.description: a schema that represents a Duration value

DateTimeSchema.description: a schema that represents a DateTime value

DateSchema.description: a schema that represents a Date value

CharSchema.description: a schema that represents a Char value

ByteArraySchema.description: a schema that represents a ByteArray value

UnixTimeSchema.description: a schema that represents a UnixTime value

DictionarySchema.description: a schema that represents a key-value collection

elementType.description: the element type of the dictionary. (Keys are always strings)

OrSchema.description: an OR relationship between several schemas

anyOf.description: the set of schemas that this schema is composed of. Every schema is optional

XorSchema.description: an XOR relationship between several schemas

oneOf.description: the set of schemas that this must be one and only one of.

not.description: the schema that this may not be.

Schemas.description: the full set of schemas for a given service, categorized into convenient collections

dictionaries.description: an associative array (ie, dictionary, hashtable, etc)

choices.description:
- this is essentially can be thought of as an 'enum' 
that is a choice between one of several strings

unknowns.description:
it's possible that we just may make this an error 
in representation.

url.description: an uri pointing to the full license text

description.description: a text description of the service

termsOfService.description: an uri to the terms of service specified to access the service

BinaryResponse.description: a response where the content should be treated as a binary instead of a value or object

binary.description: indicates that this response is a binary stream

SchemaResponse.description: a response that should be deserialized into a result of type(schema)

schema.description: the content returned by the service for a given operaiton

Operation.description: represents a single callable endpoint with a discrete set of inputs, and any number of output possibilities (responses or exceptions)

request.description: the inputs that are used to build the request.

responses.description: responses that indicate a successful call

exceptions.description: responses that indicate a failed call

profile.description: the apiVersion to use for a given profile name

apiVersions.description: API versions that this applies to. Undefined means all versions

deprecated.description: deprecation information -- ie, when this aspect doesn't apply and why

parameters.description: the parameter inputs to the operation

OperationGroup.description: an operation group represents a container around set of operations

SerializationStyle.description:
The Serialization Style used for the parameter.

Describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value.

ParameterLocation.description: the location that this parameter is placed in the http request

Default.description: A catch-all for all un-handled response codes.

HttpServer.description:
An object representing a Server.

If the uri supports template substitution, then the variables are required.

variables.description: an optional collection of variables for server templating

ServerVariable.description: An object representing a Server Variable for server URL template substitution.

$key.description: common name of the aspect -- in OAI3 this was typically the key in the parent dictionary

apiVersions.description: API versions that this applies to. Undefined means all versions

deprecated.description: deprecation information -- ie, when this aspect doesn't apply and why

schema.description: the schema type for the server variable

default.description: The default value to use for substitution, which SHALL be sent if an alternate value is not supplied.

SecurityRequirement.description: common ways of serializing simple parameters

HttpParameter.description: extended metadata for HTTP operation parameters

in.description: the location that this parameter is placed in the http request

style.description: the Serialization Style used for the parameter.

skipUriEncoding.description: when set, this indicates that the content of the parameter should not be subject to URI encoding rules.

path.description:
A relative path to an individual endpoint. 

The field name MUST begin with a slash. 
The path is appended (no relative URL resolution) to the expanded URL from the Server Object's url field in order to construct the full URL. 
Path templating is allowed. 

When matching URLs, concrete (non-templated) paths would be matched before their templated counterparts.

method.description: the HTTP Method used to process this operation

servers.description: each method must have one or more servers that it is connected to.

knownMediaType.description: a normalized value for the media type (ie, distills down to a well-known moniker (ie, 'json'))

mediaTypes.description: must contain at least one media type to send for the body

multipart.description:
indicates that the HTTP Request should be a multipart request 

ie, that it has multiple requests in a single request.

mediaTypes.description: must contain at least one media type to send for the body

method.description: the HTTP Method used to process this operation

servers.description: each method must have one or more servers that it is connected to.

statusCodes.description: the possible HTTP status codes that this response MUST match one of.

mediaTypes.description: the possible media types that this response MUST match one of

headers.description: content returned by the service in the HTTP headers
